document.masterDocTitle: Revision of Labidostomis (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae: Cryptocephalinae: Clytrini) with large united elytral spot from Iran and adjacent countries

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of Labidostomis (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae: Cryptocephalinae: Clytrini) with large united elytral spot from Iran and adjacent countries

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Labidostomis elegans var. luristanica
Pic, 1920 : 6
(unavailable infrasubspecific name);
Rapilly, 1984b : 216
(as synonym of
L. shirazica
).

Labidostomis ( Labidostomis ) luristanica
Warchałowski, 2004 : 557
(validated as name of species);
Regalin & Medvedev 2010 : 571
(catalogue);
Warchałowski 2010 : 82
(key).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type locality.
Labidostomis elegans var. luristanica
: “Luristan” [= Iran, Lorestan province].

Types examined.
Labidostomis elegans var. luristanica
: Syntype: ♀, “v. Bodemeyer / Persien / Luristan [w, p] // elegans [w, h] // v. luristanica / Pic [w, h] // v. luristanica Pic [b, h] // type [w, h] // TYPE [r, p] // Museum Paris [p] / Pic [w, h] // Labidostomis / shirazicus Lopatin [h] / M Rapilly dét. 19 [p] 81 [w, h]” (MNHN—coll. generale).

Additional material examined. 11 specimens
—

: Kurdistan prov.:

♂♂ 2 ♀♀
,
D. Farbiak leg. ( NMPC ); 30 km S of Sanandaj , Danan env., 35°01´18´´N 46°59´06´´E ,
1350 m
, 14.
v.2016, 2
♂♂, 1 ♀
,
D. Frank leg. ( DFCP ).
Chaharmahal and Bakhtiari prov. :

, 10.

♀
,

,

Zanjan prov.:
7 km E of Sa
´id Abad , 36°23.3´N 48°11.7´E ,

♂
, J. Hájek & P. Chvojka leg. (NMPC).
Diagnostic characters. Body length: ♂♂ 5.1–6.9 mm; ♀♀ 5.0–6.1 mm.
Distribution. Iran ( Lorestan , Chaharmahal and Bakhtiari, Kurdistan , Zanjan provinces).

Differential diagnosis.
Labidostomis luristanica
has brownish labrum medially darkened and large elytral spot always reaching the scutellum. Similar species
L. shirazica
and
L. regalini
sp. nov.
differ in the structure of internal sclerites of aedeagus ( Figs. 22–25 ). Moreover, the males of
L. shirazica
have convergent inner margins of clypeal processes ( Fig. 17 ). The females of
L. luristanica
have very long ductus spermathecae, ca 6 times as long as vasculum ( Fig. 10 ), while ductus spermathecae in females of
L. shirazica
and
L. regalini
sp. nov.
is much shorter, ca 2–3 times as long as vasculum ( Fig. 11, 12 ).

Comments. As shown by Bezděk & Regalin (2015) ,
Labidostomis elegans var. luristanica
was described in a paper containing also description of subspecies ( Pic 1920 ), thus it became infrasubspecific according to Article 45.6.4 of the Code (
ICZN 1999
). However, it was validated by Warchałowski (2004) who treated it as a valid species and thus established a new name with new authorship in agreement with Article 45.5.1 (
ICZN 1999
).

The male from Zanjan province is attributed to
L. luristanica
with some doubts. The ejaculatory guide has narrower lateral lamellas and longer middle process in comparison with additional specimens ( Figs. 22, 23 ). Also the anterior margin of elytral discal spot does not reach the scutellum as in the specimens from other provinces.
